intro: Urobotrya floresensis, commonly known as the Flores starling tree, is a unique flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Flores. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or disturbed habitats. Its foliage is typically dense and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value. Urobotrya floresensis is also of interest to botanists due to its potential ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
